intro: Lamanonia grandistipularis, commonly known as the large-stipule lamanonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
